After some internships elsewhere, in 2017 I got my first job as a web developer at GHC Travel. 
I was responsible for migrating and modernizing their existing website from pure PHP to Laravel 6

syncronet.description:
After COVID-19 hit Denmark, I unfortunately had to change jobs. 
I got a job at Syncronet where I have been around to help develop their video streaming platform. 
In broad strokes, I took most of it.

juice.name: Web developer at JUICE üëä
juice.description:
In 2023, I got the opportunity to be part of something new and exciting. 
I got a job at JUICE, where I have helped develop a platform that turns the job market upside down.
juice.description_2:
Like a boomerang, I'm back at Juice again. 
:)

supeo.name: Developer at Supeo
supeo.description:
At Supeo, I have been given an exciting opportunity to work with primarily Laravel and React, we work with several different domains in a changeable everyday life. 
In short, no two days are alike and there are plenty of opportunities to learn new things.

servers.description: I have experience with many different Linux distros, and can set up a server or a cluster from scratch.

features.headline: Get in the air safely and quickly
features.tagline: With me on the team, you have a teammate who can lift a bit of everything

hero.headline:
üëã I'm Jonas, a web developer from Slagelse. 
{0} I have been working with PHP and Laravel since 2015, {0} and since then have helped develop a ticket agency, a video streaming platform and {0} a recruiting platform.
hero.headline1: I thrive on new and exciting ideas and challenges, and am always ready to learn something new.
hero.headline2: And recognizes the importance of writing clean and readable code that is easy to maintain.

contactForm.headline: Do I sound exciting?
contactForm.tagline: I'm always ready for a chat, so send me an email ü§ó

content.question: Why React & Laravel?
content.answer: Popularity, ease of use and honing my skills with tools i actively use at my job. {0} React in particular because i can experiment with packages and tools i wouldn't otherwise choose at work.

content.question: Isn't it a bit overkill to use React & Laravel for a personal website?
content.answer: Perhaps, i could probably get away with using a static site generator but i find more value in using tools i actively use at my job.

content.question: How are you hosting this site?
content.answer: Initially i used fly.io which was a breeze but i figured i could reduce costs by hosting it myself. {0} I'm using a self-built FreeBSD box with Nginx, PHP, Redis and PostgreSQL in separate jails.

content.question: Why FreeBSD?
content.answer: Well, i started off building the box as a NAS with then FreeNAS now TrueNAS. {0} After tinkering with it and diving into FreeBSD and ZFS it has quickly grown on me and it's a learning experience to manage it myself.
